environments.title: Environments
environments.description: The list of environments which Mantle can deploy to.

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: The owner of the resources that will be created. Defaults to `"personal"`.

payments.title: Payments
payments.description: Where Robux should come from to purchase resources (if `--allow-purchases` is enabled). Defaults to `"owner"`.

state.title: State
state.description: Defines how Mantle should manage state files (locally or remotely). Defaults to `"local"`.

target.title: Target
target.description: Defines the target resource which Mantle will deploy to. Currently Mantle only supports targeting Experiences, but in the future it will target other types like Plugins and Models.

AssetTargetConfig.title: Asset
AssetTargetConfig.description:
If set to `"file"`, the value should be a file path or glob to an asset or list of assets. The `rbxgameasset` name of each matched file will be its file name without the extension. For example, `assets/pirate-flag.png` will be given the `rbxgameasset` name `pirate-flag` and will be accessible in the experience with `rbxgameasset://Images/pirate-flag`.

If set to an object, `file` should be set to a file path (it will not be interpreted as a glob), and `name` will be the name of the `rbxgameasset`.

```yml title="Example" target: experience: assets: - assets/* - file: marketing/icon.png name: game-icon ```

:::caution By default, Mantle does not have permission to make purchases with Robux. Since creating and updating audio assets costs Robux, you will need to use the `--allow-purchases` flag when you want to create or update them. :::

Each file will be uploaded as the asset type matching its file extension. Supported asset types and their file extensions:

| Asset type | File extensions                                 | | :--------- | :---------------------------------------------- | | Image      | `.bmp`, `.gif`, `.jpeg`, `.jpg`, `.png`, `.tga` | | Audio      | `.ogg`, `.mp3`                                  |

AvatarAssetOverridesTargetConfig.title: AvatarAssetOverrides
AvatarAssetOverridesTargetConfig.description: ```yml title="Example" target: experience: configuration: avatarAssetOverrides: face: 7699174 shirt: 5382048848 pants: 5611120855 ```

face.title: Face
face.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's face.

head.title: Head
head.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's head.

leftArm.title: Left Arm
leftArm.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's left arm.

leftLeg.title: Left Leg
leftLeg.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's left leg.

pants.title: Pants
pants.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's pants.

rightArm.title: Right Arm
rightArm.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's right arm.

rightLeg.title: Right Leg
rightLeg.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's right leg.

shirt.title: Shirt
shirt.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's shirt.

torso.title: Torso
torso.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's torso.

tshirt.title: T-shirt
tshirt.description: The asset ID to override the avatar's t-shirt.

AvatarScaleConstraintsTargetConfig.title: AvatarScaleConstraints
AvatarScaleConstraintsTargetConfig.description: ```yml title="Example" target: experience: configuration: avatarScaleConstraints: height: min: 0.95 width: max: 0.9 proportions: min: 30 max: 50 ```

bodyType.title: Body Type
bodyType.description: The constraints to apply to the body type of the avatar.

head.title: Head
head.description: The constraints to apply to the head of the avatar.

height.title: Height
height.description: The constraints to apply to the height of the avatar.

proportions.title: Proportions
proportions.description: The constraints to apply to the proportions of the avatar.

width.title: Width
width.description: The constraints to apply to the width of the avatar.

BadgeTargetConfig.title: Badge
BadgeTargetConfig.description:
```yml title="Example" target: experience: badges: captureFirstShip: name: Capture First Ship! description: You captured your first enemy ship! icon: badges/capture-first-ship.png ```

:::caution By default, Mantle does not have permission to make purchases with Robux. Since creating badges costs Robux, you will need to use the `--allow-purchases` flag when you want to create them. :::

Because Roblox does not offer any way to delete badges, when a badge is "deleted" by Mantle, it is updated in the following ways:

1. It is disabled 2. Its description is updated to: `Name: <name>\nEnabled: <enabled>\nDescription:\n<description>` 3. Its name is updated to `zzz_Deprecated(<date-time>)` where `<date-time>` is the current date-time in `YYYY-MM-DD hh::mm::ss.ns` format.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the badge on the Roblox website and in the experience. Defaults to `""`.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether or not the badge is enabled. Defaults to `true`.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A file path to an image to use as the badge's icon on the Roblox website and in the experience.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the badge on the Roblox website and in the experience.

EnvironmentConfig.title: Environment
EnvironmentConfig.description: ```yml title="Example" environments: - name: staging branches: [dev, dev/*] overrides: configuration: genre: building - name: production branches: [main] targetAccess: public ```

branches.title: Branches
branches.description: An array of file globs to match against Git branches. If the `--environment` flag is not specified, Mantle will pick the first environment which contains a matching file glob for the current Git branch. If no environments match, Mantle will exit with a success code.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the environment that is used to identify the environment via the `--environment` flag. Must be unique across all environments.

overrides.title: Overrides
overrides.description: Environment-specific overrides for the target resource definition. This will override all configuration, including changes made by the `targetNamePrefix` and `targetAccess` fields.

tagCommit.title: Tag Commit
tagCommit.description: Whether or not to tag the commit with place file versions after successful deployments. It is recommended to only enable this on your production environment. Tags will be of the format `<name>-v<version>` where `<name>` is the name of the place and `<version>` is the place's Roblox version.

targetAccess.title: Target Access
targetAccess.description: Overrides the target's access. The implementation is dependent on the target's type. For Experience targets, the `configuration.playability` field will be overridden.

targetNamePrefix.title: Target Name Prefix
targetNamePrefix.description: Adds a prefix to the target's name configuration. The implementation is dependent on the target's type. For Experience targets, all place names will be updated with the prefix.

assets.title: Assets
assets.description: A list of assets to include in your experience.

badges.title: Badges
badges.description: Badges that can be awarded within your experience.

passes.title: Passes
passes.description: Passes that can be purchased within your experience for Robux.

places.title: Places
places.description: The places to create in the experience. There must be at least one place supplied with the name `"start"`, which will be used as the start place for the experience.

products.title: Products
products.description: Products that can be purchased within your experience for Robux.

socialLinks.title: Social Links
socialLinks.description: A list of social links that will appear on the experience's webpage.

ExperienceTargetConfigurationConfig.title: ExperienceConfiguration
ExperienceTargetConfigurationConfig.description:
```yml title="Example" target: experience: configuration: genre: naval playableDevices: [computer] playability: private privateServerPrice: 0 enableStudioAccessToApis: true icon: marketing/game-icon.png thumbnails: - marketing/game-thumbnail-fall-update.png - marketing/game-thumbnail-default.png ```

In order to configure the name and description of an experience, use the `name` and `description` fields of the `PlaceConfiguration` for the experience's start place.

allowThirdPartySales.title: Allow Third-party Sales
allowThirdPartySales.description: Whether or not this experience should allow third-party sales. Defaults to `false`.

allowThirdPartyTeleports.title: Allow Third-party Teleports
allowThirdPartyTeleports.description: Whether or not this experience should allow third-party teleports. Defaults to `false`.

avatarAnimationType.title: Avatar Animation Type
avatarAnimationType.description: The type of avatar animation that players can use in this experience. Defaults to `"playerChoice"`.

avatarAssetOverrides.title: Avatar Asset Overrides
avatarAssetOverrides.description: The asset overrides to apply to player avatars in the experience. Defaults to Roblox's defaults.

avatarCollisionType.title: Avatar Collision Type
avatarCollisionType.description: The type of avatar collision that players can use in this experience. Defaults to `"outerBox"`.

avatarScaleConstraints.title: Avatar Scale Constraints
avatarScaleConstraints.description: The scale constraints to apply to player avatars in the experience. Defaults to Roblox's defaults.

avatarType.title: Avatar Type
avatarType.description: The types of avatars that players can use in this experience. Defaults to `"r15"`.

enableStudioAccessToApis.title: Enable Studio Access to APIs
enableStudioAccessToApis.description: Whether or not studio should be able to use Roblox APIs for this place. Defaults to `false`.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A file path to an image that will be used as the experience's icon.

paidAccessPrice.title: Paid Access Price
paidAccessPrice.description: If set, paid access will be enabled with the specified price. Otherwise, paid access will be disabled. Should not be used with `privateServerPrice`.

playability.title: Playability
playability.description: Determines who has access to play the experience. Defaults to `"private"`.

playableDevices.title: Playable Devices
playableDevices.description: The devices that the experience can be played on. Defaults to `["computer", "phone", "tablet"]`

privateServerPrice.title: Private Server Price
privateServerPrice.description: If set, private servers will be enabled with the specified price. Otherwise, private servers will be disabled. To enable for free, set to `0`. Should not be used with `privateServerPrice`.

thumbnails.title: Thumbnails
thumbnails.description: An array of file paths to images that will be used as the experience's thumbnails. The order used here will be the order they appear on the Roblox webpage.

OwnerConfig.title: Owner
OwnerConfig.description:
If set to `"personal"`, all resources will be created under the authorizer user.

If set to a group, all resources will be created under the provided group ID.

```yml title="Group Example" owner: group: 5723117 ```

```yml title="Personal Example (Default)" owner: personal ```

PassTargetConfig.title: Pass
PassTargetConfig.description:
```yml title="Example" target: experience: passes: shipOfTheLine: name: Ship of the Line description: Get the best ship in the game! icon: passes/ship-of-the-line.png price: 499 ```

Because Roblox does not offer any way to delete game passes, when a pass is "deleted" by Mantle, it is updated in the following ways:

1. Its description is updated to: `Name: <name>\nPrice: <price>\nDescription:\n<description>` 2. Its name is updated to `zzz_Deprecated(<date-time>)` where `<date-time>` is the current date-time in `YYYY-MM-DD hh::mm::ss.ns` format.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the game pass on the Roblox website and in the experience. Defaults to `""`.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A file path to an image to use as the pass's icon on the Roblox website and in the experience.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the game pass on the Roblox website and in the experience.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of the game pass in Robux. If not specified, the game pass will be off-sale.

PaymentsConfig.title: Payments
PaymentsConfig.description:
If set to `"owner"`, all payments will come from the balance of the owner specified by the top-level `owner` field.

If set to `"personal"`, all payments will come from the balance of the authorized user.

If set to `"group"`, all payments will come from the balance of the group specified by the top-level `owner` field. Payments can only be set to `"group"` when `owner` is also set to a group because Roblox does not allow groups to pay for purchases of resources outside of themselves.

```yml title="Personal Example" payments: personal ```

```yml title="Group Example" payments: group ```

```yml title="Owner Example (Default)" payments: owner ```

PlaceTargetConfig.title: Place
PlaceTargetConfig.description:
```yml title="Example" target: experience: places: start: file: game.rbxlx configuration: name: Pirate Wars! description: |- Duke it out on the high seas in your pirate ship!

üçÇ Fall update: new cannons, new ship types! maxPlayerCount: 10 serverFill: robloxOptimized ```

file.title: File
file.description: A file path to a Roblox place (either `.rbxl` or `.rbxlx`).

allowCopying.title: Allow Copying
allowCopying.description: Whether or not other Roblox users can clone your place. Defaults to `false`.

description.title: Description
description.description: The descirption of the place on the Roblox website and in-game. Defaults to `"Created with Mantle"`. If the place is an experience's start place, it will be the experience's description as well.

maxPlayerCount.title: Max Player Count
maxPlayerCount.description: The maximum number of players that can be in a server for the place. Defaults to `50`.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the place on the Roblox website and in-game. Defaults to `"Untitled Game"`. If the place is an experience's start place, it will be the experience's display name as well.

serverFill.title: Server Fill
serverFill.description: Determines how Roblox will fill your servers.

PlayabilityTargetConfig.title: Playability
PlayabilityTargetConfig.description:
If set to `"public"`, the epxerience will be playable by all Roblox users.

If set to `"private"`, the experience will only be playable by the authorized user.

If set to `"friends"`, the experience will only be playable by the authorized user and that user's Roblox friends.

ProductTargetConifg.title: Product
ProductTargetConifg.description:
```yml title="Example" target: experience: products: fiftyGold: name: 50 Gold description: Add 50 gold to your wallet! icon: products/50-gold.png price: 25 hundredGold: name: 100 Gold description: Add 100 gold to your wallet! icon: products/100-gold.png price: 45 ```

Because Roblox does not offer any way to delete developer products, when a product is "deleted" by Mantle, it is updated in the following ways:

1. Its description is updated to: `Name: <name>\nDescription:\n<description>` 2. Its name is updated to `zzz_Deprecated(<date-time>)` where `<date-time>` is the current date-time in `YYYY-MM-DD hh::mm::ss.ns` format.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the developer product on the Roblox website and in the experience. Defaults to `""`.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A file path to an image to use as the product's icon on the Roblox website and in the experience. Defaults to no icon.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the developer product on the Roblox website and in the experience.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of the developer product in Robux.

bucket.title: Bucket
bucket.description: The name of your AWS S3 bucket.

key.title: Key
key.description: The key to use to store your state file. The file will be named with the format `<key>.mantle-state.yml`.

region.title: Region
region.description: The AWS region your S3 bucket is located in.

ServerFillTargetConfig.title: ServerFill
ServerFillTargetConfig.description:
If set to `"robloxOptimized"`, Roblox will attempt to automatically leave some space for friends to join.

If set to `"maximum"`, Roblox will never leave room for friends to join.

If set to reserved slots, Roblox will always leave the provided number of slots available for friends to join.

```yml title="Reserved Slots Example" target: experience: places: start: file: game.rbxlx configuration: serverFill: reservedSlots: 10 ```

SocialLinkTargetConfig.title: SocialLink
SocialLinkTargetConfig.description: ```yml title="Example" target: experience: socialLinks: - title: Follow on Twitter url: https://twitter.com/blakemdev ```

title.title: Title
title.description: The display name of the social link on the Roblox website.

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL of the social link. Must be one of the Roblox supported social link types.

StateConfig.title: State
StateConfig.description:
If set to `"local"`, Mantle will save and load its state to and from a local `.mantle-state.yml` file.

If set to a remote, Mantle will save and load its state to and from a remote file.

```yml title="Remote State Example" state: remote: region: [us-west-2] bucket: mantle-states key: pirate-wars ```

```yml title="Local State Example (Default)" state: local ```

TargetAccessConfig.title: TargetAccess
TargetAccessConfig.description:
If set to `"public"`, the target will be accessible to all Roblox users.

If set to `"private"`, the target will only be accessible to the authorized user.

If set to `"friends"`, the target will only be accessible to the authorized user and that user's Roblox friends.

TargetConfig.title: Target
TargetConfig.description:
Currently the only supported target resource type is an Experience.

```yml title="Example" target: experience: {} ```

TargetNamePrefixConfig.title: TargetNamePrefix
TargetNamePrefixConfig.description:
If set to `"environmentName"`, the target name prefix will use the format `[<ENVIRONMENT>] ` where `<ENVIRONMENT>` is the value of the environment's `name` field in all caps.

If set to a custom string, the target name prefix will use the user-specified string.

```yml title="Environment Name Example" environments: - name: staging targetNamePrefix: environmentName - name: production ```

```yml title="Custom Example" environments: - name: staging targetNamePrefix: custom: 'Prefix: ' - name: production ```

TargetOverridesConfig.title: TargetOverrides
TargetOverridesConfig.description: Override the target configuration. Should match the type of the target configuration.
